title: Cell Biology Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of cell structure, function, and biological processes
subject: Biology

questions.question: What is the main function of the cell membrane?

options.text: To control what enters and exits the cell

questions.explanation: The cell membrane is a selectively permeable barrier that controls the movement of substances into and out of the cell, maintaining homeostasis.

questions.question: All cells contain a nucleus.
questions.explanation: Only eukaryotic cells contain a nucleus. Prokaryotic cells, like bacteria, do not have a nucleus.

questions.question: Match each organelle with its primary function:

rightItems.text: Contains DNA and controls cell activities

questions.explanation: Each organelle has a specialized function: nucleus controls the cell and contains DNA, mitochondria produce energy, and ribosomes synthesize proteins.

questions.question: What is the main difference between mitosis and meiosis?

options.text: Mitosis produces gametes, meiosis produces body cells
Mitosis produces identical cells, meiosis produces genetically diverse gametes

questions.explanation: Mitosis produces two identical diploid cells for growth and repair, while meiosis produces four genetically diverse haploid gametes for reproduction.

questions.question: Prokaryotic cells are more complex than eukaryotic cells.
questions.explanation: Eukaryotic cells are more complex, containing a nucleus and various membrane-bound organelles. Prokaryotic cells are simpler and lack a nucleus.

questions.question: Which type of cell division is essential for sexual reproduction?
questions.explanation: Meiosis produces gametes (sperm and egg cells) with half the genetic material, which is essential for sexual reproduction.

questions.question: The cell membrane is made up of a single layer of phospholipids.
questions.explanation: The cell membrane is a phospholipid bilayer, meaning it has two layers of phospholipids with hydrophilic heads facing outward and hydrophobic tails facing inward.

questions.question: What happens during the interphase of the cell cycle?

options.text: Cell grows, replicates DNA, and prepares for division

questions.explanation: During interphase, the cell grows, replicates its DNA, and prepares all necessary components for cell division.

questions.question: Plant cells have chloroplasts, which animal cells do not have.
questions.explanation: Chloroplasts are organelles found in plant cells (and some protists) that carry out photosynthesis. Animal cells do not have chloroplasts.

questions.question: What is the primary function of mitochondria in cells?

options.text: To produce energy (ATP) through cellular respiration

questions.explanation: Mitochondria are the powerhouses of the cell, producing ATP (energy) through cellular respiration.
